item.title: Samsung Electronics Gets $6.4 Billion for Texas Chip Plants
item.description: The expansion includes a second factory, an advanced chip-packaging facility and research-and-development capabilities.

item.title: Israel Had Created Enormous Political Trouble for Biden. Then Iran Attacked.
item.description: The president faces pressure from both his left and right on the Middle East conflict.

item.title: Aluminum, Copper and Nickel Miners to Gain From Russian Metals Ban
item.description: Aluminum, copper and nickel miners should benefit from U.S. and U.K. restrictions on trading of Russian metals, potentially boosting prices over the medium term, Jefferies said.

item.title: CVC Confirms Amsterdam IPO Plan
item.description: Global buyout firm CVC said it plans to float on Euronext Amsterdam, raising $266 million in new money from the IPO.

item.title: OPEC Wouldn't Want to See Oil Prices Surging Too High, ING Says
item.description: OPEC members likely don’t want to see oil prices rising too high as that would risk damaging demand, ING said.

item.title: Shares in European Oil Majors Fall as Oil Dips
item.description: Shares in European oil-and-gas majors fell in early trading as oil prices dipped despite heightened Middle East tensions.

item.title: Economic Data Point to Further Widening of U.S.-German Bond Yield Spread
item.description: Economic fundamentals suggest more widening of the Treasury-Bund yield spreads, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: BNP Paribas Buys Fosun's Stake in Ageas
item.description: BNP Paribas is buying Fosun’s 9% shareholding in Belgium insurer Ageas for roughly $777 million.

item.title: Samsung Overtakes Apple as Smartphone Leader, IDC Says
item.description: Samsung Electronics has overtaken Apple as the top smartphone provider, while Chinese companies took a bigger slice of the global market, according to research firm International Data Corporation.

item.title: China's Central Bank Holds Key Policy Rates
item.description: The People’s Bank of China kept key policy rates steady and drained liquidity from the banking sector as economic data shows fresh signs of weakness.

item.title: The Lawsuits That Could Shape the Future of AI and Copyright Law
item.description: Artificial intelligence is quickly evolving, but copyright law is still playing catch-up. A lawyer breaks down three of the biggest cases to explain how the law is evolving with this technology.

item.title: How the U.S. Forged a Fragile Middle Eastern Alliance to Repel Iran's Israel Attack
item.description: The American-led effort was years in the making and hadn’t been battle-tested when Tehran launched its missile and drone barrage against Israel.

item.title: Environmentalists and charter boat captains are arguing over a proposed rule aimed at protecting whales that would limit vessel speeds along a stretch of the Atlantic Ocean at certain times of the year.
item.description: Environmentalists and charter boat captains are arguing over a proposed rule aimed at protecting whales that would limit vessel speeds along a stretch of the Atlantic Ocean at certain times of the year.

item.title: A tepid economic recovery, fear of Russian aggression, and the prospect of a Trump electoral victory in the U.S. are nudging Europe closer to China.
item.description: A tepid economic recovery, fear of Russian aggression, and the prospect of a Trump electoral victory in the U.S. are nudging Europe closer to China.

item.title: The Justice Department was under growing pressure to reach a plea deal with Julian Assange after Australia asked for one and more difficulties arose in securing the WikiLeaks founder's extradition to the U.S. from the U.K.
item.description: The Justice Department was under growing pressure to reach a plea deal with Julian Assange after Australia asked for one and more difficulties arose in securing the WikiLeaks founder’s extradition to the U.S. from the U.K.

item.title: Biden urged Israel to use caution in any response to Iran's unprecedented attack and pressed allies for a united diplomatic front in a bid to stop the hostilities from spiraling into open warfare that could engulf the Middle East and entangle the U.S.
item.description: Biden urged Israel to use caution in any response to Iran’s unprecedented attack and pressed allies for a united diplomatic front in a bid to stop the hostilities from spiraling into open warfare that could engulf the Middle East and entangle the U.S.

item.title: The chair of the Senate Commerce Committee, Maria Cantwell, said the content of a bill to end China's control of TikTok remains in play.
item.description: The chair of the Senate Commerce Committee, Maria Cantwell, said the content of a bill to end China’s control of TikTok remains in play.

item.title: Trump will become the first former president to sit for a criminal trial when he appears in a New York court to defend himself against accusations he directed an illegal scheme to pay off a porn star.
item.description: Trump will become the first former president to sit for a criminal trial when he appears in a New York court to defend himself against accusations he directed an illegal scheme to pay off a porn star.

item.title: Global buyout firm CVC was set to kick off an Amsterdam share sale, targeting a valuation of up to $16 billion in the latest sign of a pickup in initial public offerings.
item.description: Global buyout firm CVC was set to kick off an Amsterdam share sale, targeting a valuation of up to $16 billion in the latest sign of a pickup in initial public offerings.

item.title: KKR is focusing on Japan as its main market in the Asia-Pacific region, seeing many opportunities there to acquire businesses at bargain prices, executives at the investment firm said.
item.description: KKR is focusing on Japan as its main market in the Asia-Pacific region, seeing many opportunities there to acquire businesses at bargain prices, executives at the investment firm said.
